Decompose
void Decompose(
std::
vector<Matrix4x4> 
&
tm,
bool 
undoshear
)

Decomposes the matrix into a scale, shear, rotate and translate matrices.  If undoshear is true then the shear is decomposed into a Rotate X Scale X Rotate

Returns
tm

returns a list of matrices.  if undoshear == true then

tm[0]

scale matrix

tm[1]

ShearXY rotate matrix

tm[2]

ShearXY scale matrix

tm[3]

ShearXY rotate matrix

tm[4]

ShearXZ rotate matrix

tm[5]

ShearXZ scale matrix

tm[6]

ShearXZ rotate matrix

tm[7]

ShearYZ rotate matrix

tm[8]

ShearYZ scale matrix

tm[9]

ShearYZ rotate matrix

tm[10]

RotateX

tm[11]

RotateY

tm[12]

RotateZ else

tm[0]

scale matrix

tm[1]

ShearXY

tm[2]

ShearXZ

tm[3]

ShearYZ

tm[4]

RotateX

tm[5]

RotateY

tm[6]

RotateZ

FromCorrespondences
void FromCorrespondences(
std::
vector<Vector3> 
srcPoints,
std::
vector<Vector3> 
targetPoints
)

Creates an affine matrix that transforms one set of points into anther such that the distance between the points is minimized.  Based on "Least-Squares Fitting of Two 3-D Point Sets" by Arun, et al https://​ieeexplore​.ieee​.org​/document​/4767965

Parameters
srcPoints
std::vector<Vector3>

Points to transform

targetPoints
std::vector<Vector3>

target points
